definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: She gagged on a piece of hard bread.
sentences.chinese: 她被一块硬面包噎住了。

sentences.english: If you swallow too much food, you must choke your throat.
sentences.chinese: 如果你吞食太多，你的喉咙一定会噎住。

sentences.english: Small children sometimes choke or asphyxiate while trying to swallow big tablets.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿在试图吞咽大药片时有时会噎住或窒息。

sentences.english: Children can easily choke on candies.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子很容易就会被糖果噎住。

sentences.english: I almost choked on my croissant.
sentences.chinese: 我差点被羊角面包噎住了。

sentences.english: To choke or gasp, as in swallowing large amounts of liquid.
sentences.chinese: 噎住或透不过气来，如在吞下大量液体的时候。

sentences.english: I choked on my food because I was eating too fast.
sentences.chinese: 我因为吃太快而被食物噎住了。
我喝水时几乎被噎住了。

sentences.english: He choked on a particle of food.
sentences.chinese: 他让一小粒食物噎住了。

sentences.english: Wang Miao chocked on a peanut.
sentences.chinese: 王苗被一粒花生噎住了。

sentences.english: Here was my 'choking on my croissant' moment number two.
sentences.chinese: 听到这里，我第二次被羊角面包噎住了。

sentences.english: A mouthful went down the wrong way and made him choke.
sentences.chinese: 他一口没吃好使他噎住了。

sentences.english: He choked on a soya bean and died suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 他被一颗黄豆噎住，突然死去。

sentences.english: Instantly she began choking, a portion of herring having lodged suddenly in her gullet.
sentences.chinese: 她马上噎住了，一块鲱鱼突然卡在她的食管里。

sentences.english: He choked while he was eating.

definition: to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
to suppress (a sob, harsh words etc)
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to stump sb with a question
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to be angry about sth but also find it laughable
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
